alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Kaibab Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 28 at 1:28PM MST until March 29 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST TUESDAY ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 7000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches above 7000 feet, with higher amounts of 4 to 8 inches above 8000 feet. * WHERE...Areas above 7000 feet near Alpine, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Jacob Lake and Pinetop-Lakeside. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow showers are expected to move into the area late this evening from west to east, with heavier snow developing early Tuesday morning. The heaviest snow is expected to occur Tuesday morning, before gradually diminishing through the afternoon and evening hours. Snow forecast from 11 PM Today to 5 PM Tuesday: Alpine 2 to 4 inches Flagstaff 1 to 3 inches Forest Lakes 4 to 8 inches Jacob Lake 2 to 4 inches Pinetop-Lkside 1 to 3 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Kaibab Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim; White Mountains
